Class FileIterator

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--FileIterator
public class FileIterator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Iterator

Iterates over all the files in a directory and its subdirectories

Version:
1.0 - November, 1999
Author:
C. Vickery

Constructor Summary

          Sets up to return next file in this directory or any subdirectory.

Constructor Detail

FileIterator

public FileIterator(java.io.File f)
             throws java.io.IOException
Sets up to return next file in this directory or any subdirectory. Uses hasNext() to do the setup. Prints an error message if passed a regular file instead of a directory.
Parameters:
f - The directory at the root of the subtree to traverse looking for files.
Method Detail

hasNext

public boolean hasNext()
Determines whether there are any more files in this directory or any subdirectory.
Specified by:
hasNext in interface java.util.Iterator
Returns:
true if there is at least one more file.

next

public java.lang.Object next()
Returns the next file in the current directory or subdirectory. Returns null when there are no more.
Specified by:
next in interface java.util.Iterator
Returns:
The next file available.

remove

public void remove()
Specified by:
remove in interface java.util.Iterator

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Used during development to test the class. If you use this class as an application, you can give a list of directories on the command line, and this will print all the files in the tree, along with the total number of files and bytes for each directory.
